name: Wheels of Aurelia
description: A narrative road trip game set in the roaring Italian 70s, it tells the story of Lella, a restless woman driving on the roads of the western coast of Italy, the famous “Via Aurelia”.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3 + Processor: 2.0GHz CPU Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 512MB graphics card Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: This game is serious piece of art beyond my highest expectations. It's not driving game, could be called road game instead (great!).  Italia'78 with all the political turnmoil, society changing rusty paradigm and search for new ways. Issues of freedom of all kind, women liberation, religion and strong far-left faction on the scene, we have all of this mixed up here.  If all mentioned above didn't intrigue you, or you never heard of Nanni Moretti, Pasolini or Aldo Moro, then this game probably isn't for you. Simple as that.

What a wonderful, weird experience. Cruise along the Mediterranean with two girls locked in conversation listening to italodisco on the radio. There isn't really any driving. It's a branching dialog game. Conversations with each other, conversations with hitchhikers, intentional silence. Doesn't hurt that it looks gorgeous and has a groovy original soundtrack, either.
